report.report_description: Asthma is a common lung disease and a leading cause of hospitalizations for children under 15 years old. This report provides a summary of asthma indicators by neighborhood. It also describes housing and neighborhood characteristics that can make asthma worse.
report.report_text: Categories based on whether the most recent neighborhood value falls among the best, middle or worse performing third of all NYC neighborhoods. NYC is divided into 42 neighborhoods based on the United Hospital Fund (UHF) approach of aggregating zip code areas to approximate Community Planning Districts.
report.report_footer: More data and information on Asthma and the Environment can be found on the NYC Tracking Portal (www.nyc.gov/health/tracking) and on EpiQuery(www.nyc.gov/health/epiquery). The tracking program is part of the National Environmental Public Health Tracking Network (www.cdc.gov/EPHTracking).
report.unreliable_text: **Estimate is based on small numbers so should be interpreted with caution.

report_content.report_topic_description: Age-adjusted rates per 10,000 residents (or percent where indicated)

report_topic_data.indicator_name: Adults ages 18 years and older with asthma in the past 12 months (age-adjusted percent), 2020
report_topic_data.indicator_description: Asthma is a common disease characterized by breathing difficulty. Poor air quality and housing issues increase risk of developing and triggering asthma.
report_topic_data.nabe_data_note: *Estimate is based on small numbers so should be interpreted with caution.

report_topic_data.indicator_name: Asthma emergency department visits among adults ages 18 years and older, 2020
report_topic_data.indicator_description: Severe asthma attacks can result in a visit to the ED. Things like smoke, air pollution, dust mites, cockroaches, mold, pollen and pet dander can trigger asthma.

report_topic_data.indicator_name: Asthma hospitalizations among adults ages 18 years and older, 2020
report_topic_data.indicator_description: Asthma hospitalizations are more severe asthma outcomes. They're often clustered in high-poverty neighborhoods, where disinvestment and poor housing conditions expose residents to triggers.

report_content.report_topic_description: Rates per 10,000 residents, unless otherwise indicated.

report_topic_data.indicator_name: Asthma among public school children ages 5 to 14 years old (per 1,000 children), 2013-2014
report_topic_data.indicator_description: Asthma is a common disease characterized by breathing difficulty. Poor air quality and housing issues increase risk of developing and triggering asthma.

report_topic_data.indicator_name: Asthma emergency department visits among children ages 5 to 17 years old, 2020
report_topic_data.indicator_description: Severe asthma attacks can result in a visit to the ED. Things like smoke, air pollution, dust mites, cockroaches, mold, pollen and pet dander can trigger asthma.

report_topic_data.indicator_name: Asthma hospitalizations among children ages 5 to 17 years old, 2020
report_topic_data.indicator_description: Asthma hospitalizations are more severe asthma outcomes. They're often clustered in high-poverty neighborhoods, where disinvestment and poor housing conditions expose residents to triggers.

report_content.report_topic_description: Estimated health events attributable to PM2.5 exposures, (average annual rate per 100,000 residents)

report_topic_data.indicator_name: Attributable asthma emergency department visits among children under 18 years of age, 2015-2017
report_topic_data.indicator_description: PM2.5 can cause asthma ED visits, which represent part of the health burden of fine particle air pollution.

report_topic_data.indicator_name: Attributable asthma emergency department visits among adults ages 18 and older, 2015-2017
report_topic_data.indicator_description: PM2.5 can cause asthma ED visits, which represent part of the health burden of fine particle air pollution.

report_content.report_topic_description: Estimated health events attributable to ozone (O3) exposures,(average annual rate per 100,000 residents), April through September

report_topic_data.indicator_name: Attributable asthma emergency department visits among children under 18 years of age, 2015-2017
report_topic_data.indicator_description: Ozone can cause asthma ED visits, which are part of the health burden of air pollution.

report_topic_data.indicator_name: Attributable asthma emergency department visits among adults ages 18 years and older, 2015-2017
report_topic_data.indicator_description: Ozone can cause asthma ED visits, which are part of the health burden of air pollution.

report_topic_data.indicator_name: Attributable asthma hospitalizations among children under 18 years of age, 2015-2017
report_topic_data.indicator_description: Ozone can cause hospitalizations for asthma, which are part of the health burden of air pollution.

report_topic_data.indicator_name: Attributable asthma hospitalizations among adults ages 18 years and older, 2015-2017
report_topic_data.indicator_description: Ozone can cause hospitalizations for asthma, which are part of the health burden of air pollution.

report_content.report_topic_description: Percentage of homes with conditions that can affect asthma.

report_topic_data.indicator_name: Homes with cracks or holes, 2017
report_topic_data.indicator_description: Cracks or holes are a maintenance deficiency linked to the presence of mice, rats, and cockroaches - which can harm residents' health.

report_topic_data.indicator_name: Homes with leaks, 2017
report_topic_data.indicator_description: Leaks are a maintenance deficiency that can harm health by introducing mold, which can worsen respiratory conditions like asthma.

report_topic_data.indicator_name: Renter-occupied homes with any health-related maintenance problems (percent) 2017
report_topic_data.indicator_description: Homes with maintenance deficiencies can threaten the health of the people who live there.
report_topic_data.nabe_data_note: *Estimate is based on small numbers so should be interpreted with caution.

report_content.report_topic_description: Percentage of homes with potential sources of allergens and pollutants that can make asthma symptoms worse.

report_topic_data.indicator_name: Adults reporting secondhand smoke at home, 2012
report_topic_data.indicator_description: Adults reporting secondhand smoke at home. Secondhand smoke, especially indoors, is bad for health - particularly for the health of children.
report_topic_data.nabe_data_note: *Estimate is based on small numbers so should be interpreted with caution.

report_topic_data.indicator_name: Homes with cockroaches, 2017
report_topic_data.indicator_description: The presence of cockroaches in the home is often associated with poor housing maintenance. Cockroaches in the home can contaminate food and worsen asthma.

report_topic_data.indicator_name: Adults who allow smoking in the home (percent), 2013
report_topic_data.indicator_description: Adults without a smoke-free home policy. A smoke-free home policy can limit people's exposure to secondhand smoke, which is especially dangerous to children.

report_topic_data.indicator_name: Adults reporting mice in the home, 2012
report_topic_data.indicator_description: Mice and rats are a source of household allergens connected to developing or worsening asthma.

report_content.report_topic_description: Outdoor pollutants that can worsen asthma symptoms.

report_topic_data.indicator_name: Fine particulate matter (PM2.5) (mean mcg per cubic meter), Annual Average 2021
report_topic_data.indicator_description: Fine particles are emitted by vehicles, building boilers, and other combustion - and are a major form of air pollution that harms health.

report_topic_data.indicator_name: Ozone (O3) (mean ppb), Summer 2021
report_topic_data.indicator_description: Ozone is a common air pollutant that can harm breathing and worsen asthma and other respiratory conditions.

report_content.report_topic_description: These indicators describe conditions that make a neighborhood more at-risk for asthma.

report_topic_data.indicator_name: Living in poverty, 2017-21
report_topic_data.indicator_description: The percent of households with incomes below the federal poverty level. Households without sufficient resources are often deprived of access to items such as health care and good quality housing that are needed to maintain good health.

report_topic_data.indicator_name: Adults with health insurance, 2020
report_topic_data.indicator_description: Health insurance coverage is associated with numerous beneficial health effects. Those with health insurance are more likely to have a regular doctor, receive preventive care services, better manage chronic health conditions, have longer life expectancy, and more.
